snippet: President Obama’s decision was seen as being for national security interests, despite differences with Egypt on democracy and human rights.
abstract: Pres Obama lifts weapons freeze against Egypt that he imposed after country's military overthrow in 2013, seeking to mend ties to regional ally amid burgeoning war in Middle East; in trade-off, he tells Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi he will support full $1.3 billion in yearly military aid Egypt traditionally gets.

byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s decision was seen as being for national security interests, despite differences with Egypt on democracy and human rights.

headline.main: Obama Removes Weapons Freeze Against Egypt
headline.print_headline: Obama Removes Weapons Freeze Against Egypt
